title: Data Analyst
description: Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, Apex Systems, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!<p><br></p><strong>Job#: 1358360</strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>Apex Systems, the Nation's 2nd largest Technical Staffing and Services Firm, has an opening for <strong>Data Analyst</strong> for a large medical device company in Des Plaines, IL for an 4-month contract duration + possibility for extension!<p><br></p><ul><li>If you are interested in this role, please email your resume and availability for a phone conversation to Scott Johnson, Account Manager at</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Data Analyst</strong><p><br></p>Location: Des Plaines, IL<p><br></p><strong>Job Description</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Analyze data, draw insights, and present results in a cohesive, intuitive, and simplistic manner to the client</li><li> Utilize technologies to collect, clean, analyze, predict, and effectively communicate information</li><li> Prepare both structured and unstructured data for analysis</li><li> Able to examine data sets and determine the best end-to-end analysis plan to address key business questions and create value for the client</li><li> Works with stakeholders to define business questions, requirements, timelines, objectives, and success criteria to address need.</li><li> Proactively identifies opportunities for significant operational, process or system level product improvements.</li><li> Communicate model logic and restrictions</li><li> Work closely with the business to understand the domain and iteratively refine analyses</li><li> Transform analytical results into actionable recommendations for business partners using deep industry knowledge</li><li> Ability to understand, analyze and action on complex datasets (i.e. via Excel including Pivots, DOMO)</li><li> Use SQL to manage complex and nuanced datasets, troubleshoot quality issues, and support curation of data metrics for internal stakeholders</li><li> Maintain existing transformations (ETLs) and participate in the development of new transformation workflows in the BI tool (Domo)</li><li> Creating unique and intuitive data visualizations and reports for management to summarize key insights across independent databases</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualification</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> 3+ years SQL experience</li><li> 2+ years data visualization experience</li><li> 2+ years of industry experience in a data-related field</li><li> Highly advanced Excel skills</li><li> Clear communication and presentation skills, can articulate complex issues concisely</li><li> Thoughtful approach to writing code and creating comprehensive documentation</li><li> Ability to work independently to solve issues and drive projects forward</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>About Apex Systems: </strong><ul><li>Apex offers a number of resources to our contractors including:</li><ul><li>Training and Development programs - We have a webinar series with global experts who deliver 3-4 technical and leadership webinars a month around hot topics/technologies such as Agile, DevOps, Angular, Node, React, JavaScript, .NET Core, Java 8/9, Redux, Ansible, Kubernetes, etc. Many of these webinars are worth certification credits for major certifying bodies such as PMI, IIBA, and CompTIA (i.e. PDU, CDU, and CEU credits). We can also provide a technical training license (eligibility required)</li><li>Benefits - Health, Dental, Vision, 401K, and Employee Stock Purchase Program</li><li>Strong Support Network - A network of Recruiters, Support Services, and Contractor Care Representatives are here to help our contractors succeed. We have a job portal which has all of our job openings with our 1,200+ clients. We also have off-boarding/end of assignment resources to help you during the transition when you're wrapping up, including a Career Coaching Program and 15+ Career Readiness workshops for job seekers</li><li>Awards - Apex is a proud recipient of the Best of Staffing awards for both Client Satisfaction and Contractor Satisfaction</li></ul></ul><p><br></p><strong>EEO Employer</strong><p><br></p>Apex Systems is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate or allow discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, genetic information, registered domestic partner status, marital status, disability, status as a crime victim, protected veteran status, political affiliation, union membership, or any other characteristic protected by law. Apex will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law. If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position, and you require an accommodation in using our website for a search or application, please contact our Employee Services Department at or .<p><br></p>EEO Employer<p><br></p>Apex Systems is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate or allow discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, genetic information, registered domestic partner status, marital status, disability, status as a crime victim, protected veteran status, political affiliation, union membership, or any other characteristic protected by law. Apex will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law. If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position, and you require an accommodation in using our website for a search or application, please contact our Employee Services Department at or .<p><br></p>Apex Systems is a world-class IT services company that serves thousands of clients across the globe. When you join Apex, you become part of a team that values innovation, collaboration, and continuous learning. We offer quality career resources, training, certifications, development opportunities, and a comprehensive benefits package. Our commitment to excellence is reflected in many awards, including ClearlyRated's Best of Staffing® in Talent Satisfaction in the United States and Great Place to Work® in the United Kingdom and Mexico.

title: Data Governance Analyst
description: <strong>Data Analyst </strong><p><br></p><strong> Data Support Analyst, Wealth Management </strong><p><br></p>This individual contributor role sits in the Wealth Management Business Data Operation Team and reports into the Chief Data Officer's organization. Individual is expected to work independently as well as part of a team.<p><br></p>Primary responsibility is to improve data quality across the Wealth Management.<p><br></p><strong> Responsibilities include: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Diligently working on assigned intake items associated to a data quality issue</li><li> Build authentic relationships with business and IT partners</li><li> Analyze large datasets or business processes and perform root cause analysis on reported data issues</li><li> Identify process breakdowns, manual activities that could be automated, system integration concerns, training needs, and/or policy changes required, etc. and clearly articulate the reason for the issue to have occurred</li><li> Investigate alternatives to fix the identified issues by developing mitigation strategies</li><li> Document recommendation to strategically fix the root cause. If technology work is required, help write business case to obtain funding for remediation</li><li> Facilitate and oversee the implementation of those mitigation activities</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications - External</strong><p><br></p><strong> Skillset needed: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Accurately interpret non-conformances appearing on data quality reports and investigate possible causes.</li><li> Perform statistical analysis using SQL, modeling, and other quantitative techniques in order to resolve business data issues and/or recommend courses of action to mitigate those issues.</li><li> Utilize strategies that reduce data issues with a bias for preventing recurrence, and increase the consistency / confidence of data used for decision making, improving knowledge firm-wide.</li><li> Participate in periodic reviews to ensure continued compliance to both Enterprise and Wealth Management data governance policies (includes compliance assessments, monitoring and control testing) and standards.</li><li> Resolve conflicting priorities among data owners, data consumers, and custodians, especially across organizational lines.</li><li> Collaborate with partners across the Wealth Management business and outside (Corporate Functions and Technology Teams) in maintaining data quality controls ensuring we are meeting business needs while balancing quality, risk, and cost.</li><li> Work efficiently and respectfully with other team members to support Wealth Management applications, such as Operational Data Store, Product Catalog, and Data Warehouse.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> A College or University Degree in related disciplines (Finance, Accounting, Analytics, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, etc.)</li><li> 2-5 years of relevant work experience. Financial Services background is preferred.</li><li> Knowledge of Data Governance and Data Management principles and best practices.</li><li> Effective in communicating the role of Data Management to both business and technical communities.</li><li> Excellent oral and written communication and presentation skills.</li><li> In-depth functional knowledge (e.g. root cause analysis).</li><li> Highly flexible and adaptable to change.</li><li> Technical skills, e.g. SQL.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong> Data Analyst </strong><p><br></p><strong> Data Support Analyst, Wealth Management </strong><p><br></p>This individual contributor role sits in the Wealth Management Business Data Operation Team and reports into the Chief Data Officer's organization. Individual is expected to work independently as well as part of a team.<p><br></p>Primary responsibility is to improve data quality across the Wealth Management.<p><br></p><strong> Responsibilities include: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Diligently working on assigned intake items associated to a data quality issue</li><li> Build authentic relationships with business and IT partners</li><li> Analyze large datasets or business processes and perform root cause analysis on reported data issues</li><li> Identify process breakdowns, manual activities that could be automated, system integration concerns, training needs, and/or policy changes required, etc. and clearly articulate the reason for the issue to have occurred</li><li> Investigate alternatives to fix the identified issues by developing mitigation strategies</li><li> Document recommendation to strategically fix the root cause. If technology work is required, help write business case to obtain funding for remediation</li><li> Facilitate and oversee the implementation of those mitigation activities</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> A College or University Degree in related disciplines (Finance, Accounting, Analytics, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, etc.)</li><li> 2-5 years of relevant work experience. Financial Services background is preferred.</li><li> Knowledge of Data Governance and Data Management principles and best practices.</li><li> Effective in communicating the role of Data Management to both business and technical communities.</li><li> Excellent oral and written communication and presentation skills.</li><li> In-depth functional knowledge (e.g. root cause analysis).</li><li> Highly flexible and adaptable to change.</li><li> Technical skills, e.g. SQL.</li></ul><p><br></p>Additional Information

title: Quality Assurance Analyst
description: We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.<p><br></p>At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.<p><br></p>To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com<p><br></p><strong>Job Description</strong><p><br></p>Community Development is responsible for managing the Bank’s Community Impact initiatives, providing financing to support community development in the communities we serve and cultivating relationships and partnerships with our local communities. CIBC Bank USA is committed to supporting causes that matter to our clients, our employees and our communities. We aim to make a difference in communities through specialized community development financing, corporate donations, sponsorships and the volunteer spirit of our employees.<p><br></p><strong>What you'll be doing:</strong><p><br></p>The Quality Assurance Analyst’s primary role will be to support the Community Development Group to ensure compliance with regulatory and CIBC reporting requirements and monitoring of the existing Community Development Group loan portfolio.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities include:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Primarily responsible for ensuring the Community Development Group’s compliance with Regulation B on a daily basis. Complete required Regulation B reporting to CIBC’s Compliance team on a monthly basis.</li><li>Completion of the risk rating validation of the Community Development Group loan portfolio on a quarterly basis (including fiscal year end).</li><li>Completion of monthly reporting on non-performing, criticized and past due loans to CIBC’s Credit Risk Management team.</li><li>Review transactions closed on a monthly basis to document and report any credit exceptions to Community Development Group’s credit policy and procedures. Assist with the reporting of credit exceptions to the Small Business Exception Forum.</li><li>Completion of Notices of Default and Collection letters to Community Development Group customers that are past due on loan payments (including loan maturities).</li><li>Provide necessary loan documents to CIBC’s outside collection agency for transactions that are transferred to collections.</li><li>Complete necessary reporting on Community Development Group real estate transactions.</li><li>Provide supporting documentation to support ongoing Compliance monitoring as well as annual Compliance audits.</li><li>Complete the necessary reporting to Compliance associated with any formal complaints received from existing or prospective Community Development Group customers.</li><li>Assist with updates of business-specific processes and procedures, as applicable, in alignment with existing frameworks, policies, standards, and risk appetites.</li><li>Assist with the account management including the monitoring of past due payments received from of distressed portfolio accounts. </li><li>Work with Governance &amp; Controls teams (1Bs) or Internal Audit as needed to respond to Internal Audit reviews and findings.</li><li>Support procedural training (as applicable)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Compliance Requirements/Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p>Our CIBC risk culture is based on employees striving to exceed the expectations of ourselves and our leadership’s identification and mitigation of risks in their daily responsibilities, not just in quarterly or annual monitoring/assessments. We all are accountable for managing risk.<p><br></p>As an employee of CIBC the incumbent must conduct themselves (and foster an environment for others) in a manner consistent with our strong risk culture. This includes:<p><br></p><ul><li>Following all aspects of the CIBC Code of Conduct, as well as all applicable CIBC policies, frameworks, guidelines, processes and controls</li><li>At all times acting in accordance with our Purpose and shared values, to achieve our Bank’s strategic goals</li><li>Understanding and following the qualitative and quantitative components of our Risk Appetite Statements</li><li>Completing all annual Corporate Mandatory Training and Testing modules, as well as any additional business-specific modules, as required and employing the learnings in daily activities and undertakings</li><li>Escalating matters through one of the appropriate channels identified in the CIBC Code of Conduct (i.e., HR, management, Ethics Hotline, Whistleblower, etc.) upon observing activities that may be inconsistent with CIBC’s policies, frameworks, guidelines, processes and controls</li><li>Speaking up if witnessing behaviors that drive poor or unfair outcomes for clients, team members or other stakeholders</li><li>Escalating matters that can result in adverse market practices and outcomes, thereby negatively impacting CIBC’s reputation as a leading financial institution</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Knowledge and Skills:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>College education and equivalent of 3+ years of job experience in financial services industry.</li><li>Proficiency in banking applications and Microsoft suite of products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.)</li><li>Possess creative problem-solving abilities</li><li>Strong interpersonal skills</li><li>Excellent verbal and written communication</li><li>Good organizational skills including attention to detail and follow through</li><li>Ability to work well under compressed time constraints</li><li>Ability to manage multiple tasks/projects at one time</li></ul><p><br></p>California residents — your privacy rights regarding your actual or prospective employment<p><br></p><strong>What you need to know:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com</li><li>You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What You Need To Know</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com</li><li>You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Job Location</strong><p><br></p>IL-120 S LaSalle St<p><br></p><strong>Employment Type</strong><p><br></p>Regular<p><br></p><strong>Weekly Hours</strong><p><br></p>40<p><br></p><strong>Skills</strong><p><br></p>Accounting, Business, Credit, Lending, Risk Management

title: Software Test Engineer 2
description: If you are a current Chamberlain Group employee, please click here to apply through your Workday account.<p><br></p>This position will contribute to the software release quality by applying primarily manual testing techniques. This role is within the Quality Engineering function. Quality Engineering supports quality related initiatives across multiple Chamberlain Group Business Units. A successful incumbent is expected to (i) Support high quality software and firmware releases through ongoing manual testing, (ii) document identified defects in a clear an concise manner, (iii) work with engineering teams to develop/update test plans to ensure coverage as new features are developed.<p><br></p>Job Responsibilities:<p><br></p><ul><li>Hands on contribution to quality assurance through primarily manual testing methods and may involve testing of the one or more of the following depending on assignment: mobile apps (Android and iOS), web sites, hardware products (such as Garage Door Opene</li><li>Adhere to best practices for firmware, web, middleware, and mobile-based applications</li><li>Mentor junior Quality Engineering staff members with internal processes and best practices</li><li>Support senior staff members to define process and strategy associated with testing</li><li>Plan test schedules or strategies in accordance with project scope / delivery dates</li><li>Responsible for creation, execution, and maintenance of test plans</li><li>Continuously improves and revises testing standards, processes, methodologies, and documentation</li><li>Collaborate with agile team members, scrum master and developers</li><li>Manage complete scope of work assigned and coordinate with remote and external teams</li><li>Participate in Scrum, Daily Stand-up, Sprint and iterative development activities as assigned – be prepared to take on any role within the Agile team</li><li>Work with Software Engineers and Product Managers to ensure test cases/plans are updated as new features are developed</li><li>Provide accurate traceability and bug reports for Go/No-Go decisions and take ownership and accountability</li><li>Responsible for complying wit</li><li>Comply with health and safety guidelines and rules; managers should also ensure compliance across their teams</li><li>Protect Chamberlain Group’s reputation by keeping information confidential</li><li>Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, reading professional publications, establishing personal networks, and participating in professional societies</li><li>Contribute to the team effort by accomplishing related results and participating on projects as needed</li></ul><p><br></p>Job Requirements:<p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Computer Science or related field or similar experience</li><li>2+ years experience in execution of manual tests cases in web and mobile applications</li><li>Experience with Bug Tracking and collaboration tools (e.g. Jira, Confluence)</li><li>Minimum 2 years’ experience in agile testing</li><li>Hands on experience with mobile testing – b</li></ul><p><br></p>Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:<p><br></p><ul><li>Experience with sanity, smoke, regression testing</li><li>Excellent oral and written communication skills</li><li>Attention to detail and strong organizational skills</li></ul><p><br></p>Preferred Job Requirements:<p><br></p><ul><li>Automated testing experience a plus</li><li>Hardware testing experience a plus</li><li>Proficiency with one or more of the following programming languages and frameworks: C#, Java, Python, .NET/Java frameworks</li></ul><p><br></p>We're an organization who values its human capital and provides support to assist its employees succeed.<p><br></p>Chamberlain Group is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. You will be considered for this position based upon your experience and education, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, ancestry; marital, disabled or veteran status. We are committed to creating and maintaining a workforce environment that is free from any form of discriminations or harassment.<p><br></p>Persons with disabilities who anticipate needing accommodations for any part of the application process may contact, in confidence Recruiting@Chamberlain.com.<p><br></p>NOTE: Staffing agencies, headhunters, recruiters, and/or placement agencies, please do not contact our hiring managers via email or phone or other methods.

description: Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, Xoriant Corporation, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!<p><br></p>Data Warehouse Developer<p><br></p>Location: Chicago, IL - Hybrid Role (2 days in office)<p><br></p>Duration: 6 Months<p><br></p><strong>Need Locals only</strong><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications:</strong><p><br></p><strong>Requirements</strong>:<p><br></p><ul><li> At least 7 years of experience in data warehousing development, implementation, and support.</li><li> Strong SQL analysis skills and experience in database tuning and optimization.</li><li> Experience in data modeling using Kimball methodology is preferred.</li><li> At least 3 years of experience in Oracle Data Integrator (ODI) 12c version.</li><li> Excellent team player with strong communication skills.</li><li> Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with minimal supervision. This is a Hybrid role with 2 days in office.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p>Job Responsibilities :<p><br></p><ul><li> Design, develop, and maintain the data warehouse using Oracle database and Oracle Data Integrator (ODI) for ETL.</li><li> Work with stakeholders to gather and analyze requirements for data warehousing solutions.</li><li> Develop ETL jobs using ODI to extract, transform, and load data from various sources into the data warehouse.</li><li> Perform performance tuning of the data warehouse, ETL jobs, and SQL queries to ensure optimal performance and scalability.</li><li> Develop and maintain data models using Kimball methodology for data warehousing design.</li><li> Support data operations by monitoring, troubleshooting, and resolving data issues.</li><li> Collaborate with the development team to integrate data warehouse solutions with other enterprise systems.</li></ul>

title: Linux Engineer
description: Fantastic opportunity for innovative cyber security experts to join an elite team at a tech-focused market-maker. Using the best technology and tools in the market, they develop prop trading strategies, technology and algorithms to make tens of thousands of trades per second.<p><br></p>Collaborating with global partners across the business, you will champion the continuous effort to evolve and strengthen the firm's security, developing policies and procedures on information security controls. You'll stay abreast of industry developments and apply this knowledge when you are analyzing source system data and assessing security risks, proposing new ideas where appropriate. You will also liaise with the business and IT, helping them to implement data security, compliance requirements and information security technologies.<p><br></p>The successful candidate will be have a passion for cyber security, with outstanding written and oral communication skills and the ability to build strong cross-functional relationships.<p><br></p><strong>Requirements</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>5+ years' hands-on experience in corporate cyber security (in finance would be ideal)</li><li>Experience working in a distributed team model</li><li>Good knowledge of technical aspects of cybersecurity and best practices</li><li>Data analytics skills preferred</li><li>Legal right to work in the US is required, visa sponsorship is not available</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Rewards and Incentives </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Incredible salary + profit-sharing structure</li><li>Truly collaborative culture, working with the smartest minds in the industry</li><li>Real business impact from day one</li><li>Benefits include: 25 days' vacation, charitable match opportunities &amp; fully-paid travel</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Contact</strong><p><br></p>If you feel you a strong candidate for the role and would like further info, please contact:<p><br></p><strong>Greg Leigh-Jones</strong><p><br></p>gregleighjones@oxfordknight.com<p><br></p>linkedin.com/in/greg-leigh-jones-8a457011a/

title: Cyber Security Business Analyst - Chicago- Leading High Frequency Trading Firm
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>The Infrastructure Engineer works on holistic engineering deliverables across different stages of the product lifecycle and determines technology patterns for the overall solution. This role takes the lead in guiding more junior engineers and is a role model in fostering the adoption of new technologies. Actively manages and escalates risk and customer-impacting issues within the day-to-day role to management.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Achieves product commitments (and influences others to do the same) by using informal leadership &amp; highly developed communication skills and contributes to or led technology communities </li><li>Uses automation, system tools, open-source solutions, observability and 'security first' principles in daily work </li><li>Contributes to team agile ceremonies, leads demos and presentations, helps new engineers learn established norms </li><li>Initiates high level solution design approaches, and guides team to achieve desired key software delivery capabilities using automated, coded enterprise and observability </li><li>Participates in internal speaking and advocacy events </li><li>Supports research activities to adopt new technology solutions in ways of developing new capabilities </li><li>Continues professional education and creates opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices </li><li>Coaches immediate chapter and actively fosters the adoption of new technologies </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors – Computer Science or related </li><li>3+ Years – (Software) Engineering, DevOps or related </li><li>Internal applicants only: technical proficiency rating of competent on the Dreyfus engineering scale </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Points If You Have:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Golang programing language</li><li>OpenShift/Kubernetes</li><li>Linux administration/scripting skillset</li><li>AWS – RDS</li><li>Git/GitHub, Jenkins CI/CD</li><li>Strong verbal and written communication skills.</li><li>Strong collaboration skills, responsive to service needs and project demands in a fast-changing environment.</li><li>Working in agile environment</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $84,500.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description: <p><strong>NO C2C</strong></p><p><br></p><p><strong><u>Title:</u> </strong>Workday Financial Integration Developer</p><p><br></p><p>This role will ultimately be responsible for the healthy and upkeep of the finance related integrations configured in Workday including but not limited to customer/supplier, AR, AP and Banking. Job responsibilities will include working on enhancements to existing integrations/reports, building new integrations/reports, troubleshooting and resolving production issues and general upkeep of the environment. They will be responsible for the overall health of data flowing into and out of the financial platform. The ideal candidate for this role not only acts quickly with a sense of urgency but has experience owning a suite of financial integrations that are built within the Core Financial Module, Accounting Center and Prism.</p><p><strong> </strong></p><p><strong>Job Duties &amp; Responsibilities:</strong></p><ul><li>Lead the technical design, build, test &amp; deployment of new/enhanced Workday financial integration solutions using a myriad of integration methods (EIBs, Core Connectors, Cloud Connect, Workday Studio, Boomerang Integration)</li><li>Maintain integrations within Workday</li><li>Become a critical team member in the active initiative to implement Workday financial (includes Core Financials, Accounting Center &amp; Prism) ramping up quickly on in-flight integrations</li><li>Document and maintain artifacts around financial integrations, dependencies and reporting requirements</li><li>Provide ongoing production support for financial integrations by conducting detailed root cause analysis that leads to timely issue resolution</li><li>Demonstrate experience in finance related integrations in areas including Banking &amp; Settlement, Supplier &amp; Customer accounts, AR/AP, Financial Reporting</li><li>Work closely with the Finance, Accounting and IT teams to plan and execute against new Workday related initiatives or enhancements</li><li>Participate in M&amp;A assessments &amp; gap analysis around potential acquisitions to determine Workday integration requirements</li><li>Engage with third party vendors as needed on planned integrations or to support and maintain existing integrations</li></ul><p> </p><p><strong>Required Skills:</strong></p><ul><li><strong>3+ years of Workday Finance Integrations Experience</strong></li><li><strong>Must understand the different ways to do integrations</strong></li><li><strong>3+ years of experience integrating systems with third-party service vendors</strong></li><li>Experience with various Workday Integration methods EIB, Core Connectors, Workday Studio &amp; BIRT</li><li>Advanced skills with Web Services, SQL, JSON, .Net </li><li><strong>Experience creating Workday custom reports and calculated fields </strong></li><li><strong>???????Will be creating "difficult reports" - level 3 and 4</strong></li><li><strong>Understand how data is being consumed</strong></li><li>Strong communication skills are required </li><li><strong>Strong understanding of Workday security</strong></li><li><strong>Workday certification is a large plus</strong></li><li><strong>Certified in Prism is a big plus</strong></li><li>Experience working with or leading Agile teams</li><li>Bachelor Degree in Computer Science or related field</li><li>Accounting Center and Prism Analytics experience is preferred</li></ul><p><strong>Personality</strong></p><ul><li>Accountable</li><li>Self starter</li><li>Show passion to want be a developer and part of a team</li><li>Good communicators</li><li>Strong team players</li><li><br></li></ul><p><br></p><p>Regards</p><p>Manoj TK</p><p>Manoj.TK@MATRIXRes.com</p>

title: Infrastructure Engineer (multiple openings) - IHM
description: We are seeking a skilled and experienced Front End Developer to join our eCommerce team at Bunzl Distribution. As a Front End Developer, you will be responsible for translating design mockups and wireframes into high-quality, interactive user interfaces. Your primary focus will be on the development of engaging and responsive web applications, ensuring seamless user experiences across multiple platforms and devices. The overall goal of the Front End Developer will be to drive and to manage the front end experience for customers, deliver a vision and framework for how we design and deploy digital solutions.<p><br></p><strong><em>Responsibilities:</em></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Collaborate with cross-functional teams including designers, back end developers, and product managers to understand project requirements and translate them into technical specifications.</li><li>Develop clean, efficient, and maintainable code using modern web technologies such as HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, and related frameworks/libraries.</li><li>Implement responsive web design principles to ensure consistent performance and optimal user experiences across various browsers, platforms, and devices.</li><li>Create visually appealing user interfaces by effectively integrating design assets, animations, and interactive elements.</li><li>Conduct thorough testing and debugging to identify and resolve issues, ensuring high-quality and error-free front end implementation.</li><li>Optimize website performance and loading speed to enhance user satisfaction and search engine rankings.</li><li>Stay updated with industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies, and recommend innovative solutions to improve user experience and overall front end development processes.</li><li>Collaborate with the back end development team to integrate front end interfaces with server-side applications, APIs, and databases.</li><li>Conduct code reviews, provide constructive feedback, and mentor junior developers to maintain code quality and encourage professional growth.</li><li>Communicate effectively with team members, stakeholders, and clients to gather requirements, provide project updates, and address any technical challenges.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><em>Requirements:</em></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Web Development, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).</li><li>5 Years proven work experience as a Front End Developer or similar role, with a strong portfolio showcasing previous projects. UI/UX and Digital Marketing a plus.</li><li>Proficiency in front end development languages and technologies, including HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript/jQuery, and related frameworks (e.g., React, Angular, Vue.js).</li><li>Solid understanding of responsive web design principles and mobile-first development practices.</li><li>Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git, Dev Ops) and front end build tools (e.g., Webpack, Gulp).</li><li>Familiarity with UI/UX design principles and the ability to work closely with designers to implement their vision. Design &amp; UX background a plus.</li><li>Knowledge of web performance optimization techniques and tools.</li><li>Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.</li><li>Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and meet project deadlines. Ability to complete tasks with a high level of autonomy.</li><li>Experience in Agile software development methodology a plus.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>So, what are you waiting for? A new career awaits you with endless opportunities.</strong><p><br></p>Bunzl is a global leader in the Cleaning &amp; Hygiene, Food Processing, Grocery, Health Care, Non-Food Retail, and Safety industries. We have grown both organically and through acquisitions to sales in excess of $10 billion. Bunzl North America is headquartered in St. Louis, Missouri. Bunzl North America owns and operates more than 100 warehouses and serves all 50 states, Puerto Rico, Canada and parts of the Caribbean and Mexico. With more than 5,000 employees and 400,000 plus supplies, Bunzl is regarded as a leading supplier in North America.<p><br></p><em>Bunzl Distribution offers competitive salaries, a comfortable work environment, and a full range of benefits including a 401k with a company</em> <em>match.</em><p><br></p><em>Bunzl Distribution has a tradition of commitment to equal employment opportunity. It is the established policy to attract and retain the best qualified people without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex/gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, age, disability or veteran status as provided by law.<br><br></em>Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities

description: Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, Aptude, Inc., is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!<p><br></p><ul><li>B.S. in Computer Science or similar field, M.S. preferred</li><li>Strong Experience in ETL and Snowflake</li><li>data engineering experience utilizing industry standard ETL/ELT tools and techniques</li><li>Expert level skill with complex SQL and proficient in SQL tuning techniques</li><li>Strong Experience in SSIS</li><li>Experience with a variety of data ingestion techniques and tools such as consumption and parsing of JSON docs, utilizing Event Hub topics and Data replication tools.</li><li>Designing and implementation of Snowflake Data platform engineering solutions</li><li>Data modeling experience using Data Vault, Star Schema techniques.</li></ul> ETL Developer with SSIS and Snowflake Experience

title: Front End Developer
description: <strong>Overview<br><br></strong><strong> PLS ® : People. Location. Service <br><br></strong>PLS—which stands for People – Location - Service—is a leading retail provider of alternative financial services. The PLS Group, headquartered in Chicago, is comprised of over 200 financial service centers in 12 states. Through our check cashing stores, we provide consumers with convenient financial products and services to help them manage their day-to-day financial needs. Although many of our customers have banking relationships, we believe that our customers use our financial services because they are convenient, transparent, and frequently more affordable than available traditional alternatives. PLS was founded in 1997 by Bob and Dan Wolfberg, who serve as Co-Presidents.<br><br><strong>Position Overview</strong><strong>:<br><br></strong>The Quality Assurance Analyst will support the quality assurance effort within Customer Financial Solutions by systematically reviewing customer interactions and applying established quality standards to approved quality scorecards. The aim of the Quality Assurance effort is to ensure that quality assurance is applied in an independent, objective and neutral manner. The goal is to improve the customer experience, and overall quality of Customer Solution Specialist’s interactions with the customer. The QA analyst also plays a key role in minimizing company exposure by the reduction of business risk through continuous improvement of business processes and adherence to corporate and Collection policies and procedures.<br><br><strong>Responsibilities<br><br></strong><strong>Job Responsibilities</strong><strong>:<br></strong><ul><li> Complete 100% of scheduled monthly quality reviews. </li><li> Participate in calibration session with CFS leadership to review performance and consistency of scoring. </li><li> Review performance at the supervisor/manager level to ensure each area/individual has the knowledge and skills required to effectively deliver on the established service commitments. </li><li> Gauge the performance of Customer Financial Solutions while providing feedback relative to compliance initiatives. </li><li> Must be able to highlight areas of risk via QA reports. </li><li> Periodically audit service results of supervisors for compliance and consistency. </li><li> Provide tracking and reporting of Quality Assurance metrics. </li><li> Create weekly, monthly, semi-annual and annual reporting for management review. </li><li> Work with training department to identify training needs. <br><br></li></ul><strong>Qualifications<br><br></strong><strong>Job Requirements</strong><strong>:<br></strong><ul><li> Bachelor's Degree in relevant field is preferred; additional years of relevant experience may be considered in lieu of a degree </li><li> 1-3 years’ experience in customer quality assurance or quality control required, which includes performing QA for a Collection or Call Center </li><li> Working knowledge of multifunctional call recording quality monitoring solutions (voice and screen capture) </li><li> Previous blended (voice, email, and chat) Contact Center quality quantification experience preferred </li><li> Excellent verbal and written communication skills </li><li> Strong listening, analytical and research skills <br><br></li></ul><strong>Physical Requirements:<br></strong><ul><li> Must be able to sit and/or stand for long periods of time. </li><li> Ability to lift 15 lbs. <br><br></li></ul><strong>Benefits:<br><br></strong>Benefits for eligible employees include medical/dental/vision, 401k, vacation, opportunities for advancement, on-going training available.<br><br><strong>We strive to demonstrate our Core Values in all positions at PLS:<br><br></strong>Communication<br><ul><li>Customer Focus</li><li>Integrity and Trust</li><li>Teamwork</li><li>Results<br><br></li></ul>PLS Financial Services is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, marital status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. PLS Financial Services will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law. PLS Financial Services is a drug-free workplace. PLS provides reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application and hiring process, please notify your Recruiter or a member of our Human Resources team talentacquisition@PLS247.com to make arrangements. The decision on granting reasonable accommodation will be made on a case-by-case basis.<br><br>For jobs located in the City of Los Angeles, consistent with the requirements of the Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance, qualified applicants with criminal histories will be considered for employment

title: ETL Developer with SSIS and Snowflake Experience
description: Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, Motion Recruitment, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!<p><br></p>We're looking for a Fullstack Python Engineer to join a quickly-growing HealthTech company with a brand new office in The Loop. Their cutting-edge prescription management platform helps patients renew prescriptions, set up delivery methods, and give feedback to their doctors regarding their symptoms and treatments to improve their healthcare. \u003cbr /\u003e \u003cbr /\u003e This company is leveraging its innovative technology in an untapped sector with lots of opportunity, enabling them to grow by 50% in the next 6 months. As a Fullstack Python Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining both front-end and back-end components of healthcare platform. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to create robust and scalable software solutions, ensuring high performance, security, and seamless user experiences. Required Skills &amp; Experience \u003cul\u003e \u003cli\u003eBachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent practical experience).\u003c/li\u003e \u003cli\u003eProven experience as a Fullstack Python Engineer or similar role, with a focus on web application development.\u003c/li\u003e \u003cli\u003eStrong proficiency in Python and related frameworks (such as Django, Flask, or FastAPI).\u003c/li\u003e \u003cli\u003eSolid understanding of front-end technologies, including HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and modern JavaScript frameworks (e.g., React, Angular, Vue.js).\u003c/li\u003e \u003cli\u003eExperience with relational databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL) and database design.\u003c/li\u003e \u003cli\u003eKnowledge of RESTful APIs and experience building and consuming them.\u003c/li\u003e \u003cli\u003eFamiliarity with version control systems (e.g., Git) and agile development methodologies.\u003c/li\u003e \u003cli\u003eStrong problem-solving skills and ability to work independently as well as in a collaborative team environment.\u003c/li\u003e \u003cli\u003eExcellent communication skills and ability to effectively communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.\u003c/li\u003e \u003cli\u003eAbility to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic startup environment.\u003c/li\u003e \u003c/ul\u003e Desired Skills &amp; Experience \u003cul\u003e \u003cli\u003eExperience with cloud platforms, especially Microsoft Azure.\u003c/li\u003e \u003cli\u003eFamiliarity with containerization technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).\u003c/li\u003e \u003cli\u003eKnowledge of payment systems, financial technology, or related industries.\u003c/li\u003e \u003cli\u003eContributions to open-source projects or a strong portfolio of personal projects.\u003c/li\u003e \u003c/ul\u003e The Offer \u003cul\u003e \u003cli\u003eBonus and Equity eligible\u003c/li\u003e \u003c/ul\u003e You will receive the following benefits: \u003cul\u003e \u003cli\u003eMedical Insurance\u003c/li\u003e \u003cli\u003eDental Benefits\u003c/li\u003e \u003cli\u003eVision Benefits\u003c/li\u003e \u003cli\u003ePaid Time Off (PTO)\u003c/li\u003e \u003cli\u003e401(k) {including match- if applicable}\u003c/li\u003e \u003c/ul\u003e \u003cp\u003e\u003cbr /\u003e Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the US on a full-time basis now and in the future.\u003cbr /\u003e \u003c/p\u003e \u003cp\u003e\u003c/p\u003e<p><br></p>

title: Call Center Quality Assurance Analyst
description: Want to learn more about this role and Jobot? Click our Jobot logo and follow our LinkedIn page!<p><br></p>Job details<p><br></p><strong>Chicago / Low Latency Linux Environment</strong><p><br></p>This Jobot Job is hosted by Katrina McFillin<p><br></p>Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply" button and sending us your resume.<p><br></p>Salary $120,000 - $160,000 per year<p><br></p><strong>A Bit About Us</strong><p><br></p>We are a global trading firm committed to leveraging technology and quantitative research to implement a diverse set of trading strategies while managing risk and responding to dynamic market conditions.<p><br></p><strong><br><br><strong>Why join us?<br></strong></strong><p><br></p>We are a team of collaborative, entrepreneurs who thrive on innovation and building greatness. We are truly passionate about what we are building and looking for likeminded individuals who want to wear multiple hats and chart their own course.<p><br></p>In addition to working with a group of passionate and determined people we also value the time and work you put in daily and want to reward the best way possible.<p><br></p><strong>Benefits</strong><p><br></p>401(k)<p><br></p>Blue Cross and Blue Shield PPO plan with the employer paying 100% of employee premiums and 50% of their dependents<p><br></p>Unlimited PTO<p><br></p>12 weeks of paid maternity/paternity leave<p><br></p>Bonus based on individual performance and company performance<p><br></p>Short and long-term disability<p><br></p>multi-monitor setup with laptop etc.<p><br></p>Office stocked with food and beverages<p><br></p><strong>Job Details</strong><p><br></p>Your primary focus will be around installing, building, deploying, and optimizing low-latency Linux servers (both bare metal and virtual). You will also be building and automating CI/CD pipelines, and working on operating system and networking upgrades. This position has no limits. There is plenty of opportunity to roll your sleeves up and tackle multiple projects in different areas. The majority of our environment is Linux based but there is some Windows as well. Our research and development arm is all built in AWS. So the majority of your time will be spent working with the physical servers but there will be opportunity to work with AWS and virtual machines as well.<p><br></p>You are someone who has a strong Linux background, worked heavily with ansible, has done scripting with either bash or python and has experience working with bare metal servers. Experience with windows and AWS is a plus.<p><br></p>Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply" button.<p><br></p><strong>Want to learn more about this role and Jobot?</strong><p><br></p>Click our Jobot logo and follow our LinkedIn page!<p><br></p>

title: Fullstack Python Engineer
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee-focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. <strong>We’re all about people, and our employees are why Discover <em>is </em>a great place to work. </strong>Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.<p><br></p>The Infrastructure Engineer works on holistic engineering deliverables across different stages of the product lifecycle and determines technology patterns for the overall solution. This role takes the lead in guiding more junior engineers and is a role model in fostering the adoption of new technologies. Actively manages and escalates risk and customer-impacting issues within the day-to-day role to management.<p><br></p>Responsible for all aspects of the x86 hardware and software lifecycle for Virtual and Windows server solutions. Core competencies include but are not limited to VMware and Windows operating systems, x86 hypervisors, scripting/automation, HCIS and x86 hardware solutions. Works in agile product delivery team. Interfaces with Product Owner, Product Architect, Application Development and Operations teams on standards exceptions or troubleshooting of issues relating to hardware/OS/application integration.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>SME-level accountability for a specific technology and backup/secondary responsibility for another technology.</li><li>Documents current environments, SOPS, future directions, technical designs, change tickets, and other items for internal operations as well as external auditors.</li><li>Will be the escalation point for other team members and knowledgeable of all team technologies.</li><li>Responds to engagements from the Command Center and 1st level operations teams to provide production fixes and root cause analysis. Available on a pager rotation for 24x7 support </li><li>Experience supporting Microsoft Windows Server technologies</li><li>Installation, configuration, and administration of virtualization infrastructures running on VMware suite of products</li><li>Experience with x86 and HCIS platforms (Nutanix, Cisco UCS)</li><li>Strong Powershell or Ansible scripting experience, especially with the goal of automation</li><li>Experience working under a Change Management umbrella, with strong policies and approval chain</li><li>Able to demonstrate a strong engineering mindset throughout the project lifecycle</li><li>Able to take responsibility and will pro-actively look to identify and improve existing processes and practices within the environment</li><li>Excellent Communication skills (spoken/written English) are a must, strong interpersonal skills</li><li>Must be able to multi-task and respond effectively under pressure</li><li>Contributes to team agile ceremonies, leads demos and presentations, helps new engineers learn established norms </li><li>Continues professional education and create opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices </li><li>Achieves product commitments (and influences others to do the same) by using informal leadership &amp; highly developed communication skills and contributes to or led technology communities </li><li>Uses automation, system tools, open-source solutions, observability and 'security first' principles in daily work </li><li>Contributes to team agile ceremonies, leads demos and presentations, helps new engineers learn established norms </li><li>Initiates high level solution design approaches, and guides team to achieve desired key software delivery capabilities using automated, coded enterprise and observability </li><li>Participates in internal speaking and advocacy events </li><li>Supports research activities to adopt new technology solutions in ways of developing new capabilities </li><li>Continues professional education and creates opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices </li><li>Coaches immediate chapter and actively fosters the adoption of new technologies </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, </strong><strong>here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors – Computer Science or related </li><li>3+ Years – (Software) Engineering, DevOps or related </li><li>Internal applicants only: technical proficiency rating of competent on the Dreyfus engineering scale </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Points If You Have:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>6+ years’ experience in large enterprise systems engineering, or related experience</li><li>Certification: Windows, VMware</li></ul><p><br></p>External applicants will be required to perform a technical interview.<p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $84,500.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)

Interfaces with Product Owner, Product Architect, Application Development and Operations teams on standards exceptions or troubleshooting of issues relating to hardware/OS/application integration.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>SME-level accountability for a specific technology and backup/secondary responsibility for another technology.</li><li>Documents current environments, SOPS, future directions, technical designs, change tickets, and other items for internal operations as well as external auditors.</li><li>Will be the escalation point for other team members and knowledgeable of all team technologies.</li><li>Responds to engagements from the Command Center and 1st level operations teams to provide production fixes and root cause analysis. Available on a pager rotation for 24x7 support </li><li>Experience supporting Microsoft Windows Server technologies</li><li>Installation, configuration, and administration of virtualization infrastructures running on VMware suite of products</li><li>Experience with x86 and HCIS platforms (Nutanix, Cisco UCS)</li><li>Strong Powershell or Ansible scripting experience, especially with the goal of automation</li><li>Experience working under a Change Management umbrella, with strong policies and approval chain</li><li>Able to demonstrate a strong engineering mindset throughout the project lifecycle</li><li>Able to take responsibility and will pro-actively look to identify and improve existing processes and practices within the environment</li><li>Excellent Communication skills (spoken/written English) are a must, strong interpersonal skills</li><li>Must be able to multi-task and respond effectively under pressure</li><li>Contributes to team agile ceremonies, leads demos and presentations, helps new engineers learn established norms </li><li>Continues professional education and create opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices </li><li>Achieves product commitments (and influences others to do the same) by using informal leadership &amp; highly developed communication skills and contributes to or led technology communities </li><li>Uses automation, system tools, open-source solutions, observability and 'security first' principles in daily work </li><li>Contributes to team agile ceremonies, leads demos and presentations, helps new engineers learn established norms </li><li>Initiates high level solution design approaches, and guides team to achieve desired key software delivery capabilities using automated, coded enterprise and observability </li><li>Participates in internal speaking and advocacy events </li><li>Supports research activities to adopt new technology solutions in ways of developing new capabilities </li><li>Continues professional education and creates opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices </li><li>Coaches immediate chapter and actively fosters the adoption of new technologies </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, </strong><strong>here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors – Computer Science or related </li><li>3+ Years – (Software) Engineering, DevOps or related </li><li>Internal applicants only: technical proficiency rating of competent on the Dreyfus engineering scale </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Points If You Have:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>6+ years’ experience in large enterprise systems engineering, or related experience</li><li>Certification: Windows, VMware</li></ul><p><br></p>External applicants will be required to perform a technical interview.<p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $84,500.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)

Apply via Dice today!<p><br></p><strong>Job Title: Test Data Management Engineer<br><br>Location: Riverwoods, IL (Onsite)<br><br>Duration: 12+ Months<br><br></strong><strong>Job Description:<br><br></strong><strong>Skills:<br></strong><ul><li>Technical solid knowledge of Optim and GenRocket</li><li>Competent understanding of Test Data Management related to data security, data masking, synthetic data creation and test data strategy planning.</li><li>Experience on DB migration/consolidation projects</li><li>Exceptional analytical and technical skills to innovate, build, and maintain well-managed data solutions and capabilities to tackle business problems.</li><li>Excellent spoken and written communication to explain the methods to a technical and non-technical audience.</li><li>The ability to think laterally and 'outside the box.'</li><li>Teamwork skills, to support colleagues and share techniques.</li><li>Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills and the persistence to apply different techniques to get the job done.</li><li>Competent in TDM functions like data masking, data provisioning, sub setting, profiling, data mining, data handling, data management and synthetic data creation, APIs, Macros</li><li>Collaborates with subject matter experts and data stewards to identify PII definitions, data strategies, policies, controls, and programs to ensure enterprise data is accurate, complete, secure, and reliable.</li><li>Reviewing data needs and driving data solutioning decisions. Provide mentoring to Test Data Analysts as needed.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Job Description:<br></strong><ul><li>Responsible for coordinating data needs across all value streams and providing insight and support into data enhancements and data improvements as identified by gap analyses.</li><li>The roles will require thought leadership and, at times, solution architecture skills, as well as various technical experience including data generation, data scrubbing, data provisioning, data obfuscation, and solutioning and designing of data architecture and engineering enhancements in distributed environments.</li></ul>

description: Job title: Storage Engineer - Backup (quantity 2)<br><br>Work location: Prefer local to Chicago (Hybrid work schedule), but open to Remote within US for right candidate<br><br>Work hours: Must work CST work hours (8:30am - 5pm, or as needed)<br><br>Bill Rate Range: $95 - $100 - based on candidates skillsets and experience (Please note, not all candidates should be a rock-star submitted at $100 - so please submit your bill rates accordingly)<br><br>Project Overview:<br><br>Provide engineering solutions in the infrastructure space with responsibility for the Systems and/or Storage environment. Providing design &amp; configuration solutions as well as day-to-day upgrades &amp; administration. Responsible for capacity planning, disaster recovery, and security where necessary. This position is strictly for the Backup Team.<br><br>Contractor’s Role:<br><br>The role will have direct responsibility for the policies and procedures, as well as ensuring appropriate test regimes are planned and executed. These individuals have extensive experience with large-scale enterprise environments and the related HW/SW issue<br><br>Experience Level:<br><br>6+ years’ experience needed, Level 3<br><br>Qualifications:<br><ul><li> Experience with Storage Technologies like Cohesity, Spectrum Protect, Data Domain, Dell ECS</li><li> Experience in automating and managing infrastructure components using Ansible.</li><li> top-notch written and verbal communication skills,</li><li> Excellent analytical and problem solving skills</li><li> Experience with storage monitoring and management tools</li><li> Have extensive experience with operating systems, network protocols, systems programming and configurations, and/or hubs, switches, and routers, Brocade switches, EMC Elastic Cloud,<br><br></li></ul>Cohesity and IBM Spectrum Protect.<br><ul><li> Bachelor’s degree in engineering, computer science or any related discipline is required, along with about six years of experience in a company’s storage environment.</li><li> Experience with disaster recovery technologies and data replication.</li><li> Knowledge of backup and recovery tools</li><li> At least 3 years in designing and implementing enterprise class storage solutions for a large company<br><br></li></ul>Nice to Haves:<br><ul><li> Knowledge and understanding of cloud storage is a plus</li><li> Knowledge of related technologies like VMWare, Windows, Unix/Linux, and databases is preferred.<br><br></li></ul>Tasks and Responsibilities:<br><ul><li> Validate and test Architecture and Design solutions to produce detailed engineering specifications with recommended design and vendor technologies and provide level 3 support to Storage operations team.</li><li> Provide engineering solutions in the infrastructure space with responsibility for the Systems and/or Storage environment.</li><li> Providing design &amp; configuration solutions as well as day-to-day upgrades &amp; administration</li><li> Responsible for capacity planning, disaster recovery, and security where necessary.</li></ul>

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description: Want to learn more about this role and Jobot? Click our Jobot logo and follow our LinkedIn page!<p><br></p>Job details<p><br></p><strong>Chicago / Low Latency Linux Environment</strong><p><br></p>This Jobot Job is hosted by Katrina McFillin<p><br></p>Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply" button and sending us your resume.<p><br></p>Salary $120,000 - $160,000 per year<p><br></p><strong>A Bit About Us</strong><p><br></p>We are a global trading firm committed to leveraging technology and quantitative research to implement a diverse set of trading strategies while managing risk and responding to dynamic market conditions.<p><br></p><strong><br><br><strong>Why join us?<br></strong></strong><p><br></p>We are a team of collaborative, entrepreneurs who thrive on innovation and building greatness. We are truly passionate about what we are building and looking for likeminded individuals who want to wear multiple hats and chart their own course.<p><br></p>In addition to working with a group of passionate and determined people we also value the time and work you put in daily and want to reward the best way possible.<p><br></p><strong>Benefits</strong><p><br></p>401(k)<p><br></p>Blue Cross and Blue Shield PPO plan with the employer paying 100% of employee premiums and 50% of their dependents<p><br></p>Unlimited PTO<p><br></p>12 weeks of paid maternity/paternity leave<p><br></p>Bonus based on individual performance and company performance<p><br></p>Short and long-term disability<p><br></p>multi-monitor setup with laptop etc.<p><br></p>Office stocked with food and beverages<p><br></p><strong>Job Details</strong><p><br></p>Your primary focus will be around installing, building, deploying, and optimizing low-latency Linux servers (both bare metal and virtual). You will also be building and automating CI/CD pipelines, and working on operating system and networking upgrades. This position has no limits. There is plenty of opportunity to roll your sleeves up and tackle multiple projects in different areas. The majority of our environment is Linux based but there is some Windows as well. Our research and development arm is all built in AWS. So the majority of your time will be spent working with the physical servers but there will be opportunity to work with AWS and virtual machines as well.<p><br></p>You are someone who has a strong Linux background, worked heavily with ansible, has done scripting with either bash or python and has experience working with bare metal servers. Experience with windows and AWS is a plus.<p><br></p>Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply" button.<p><br></p><strong>Want to learn more about this role and Jobot?</strong><p><br></p>Click our Jobot logo and follow our LinkedIn page!<p><br></p>

title: Test Data Management Engineer
description: Location:<br><br>1901 Chestnut Ave<br><br>Glenview, Illinois, 60025<br><br>United States<br><br>Category:<br><br>Legal<br><br>Date Needed by:<br><br>9/1/2023<br><br><strong>Primary Duties and Responsibilities:<br><br></strong>You bring the motivation, teamwork, and integrity and we’ll provide the collaborative culture, professional development, and respect you deserve. And if you’re good at what you do, you’ll have a career at Wespath Benefits and Investments. Join our team in Legal Services – and, if you’d like, teams such as our DEI Council, Green Team on environmental sustainability, or our Change Management team – and make an impact through your work!<br><br>Wespath, recognized as a 2017-2023 Chicago’s Best and Brightest Companies to Work For® and a 2018-2023 National Best and Brightest Companies to Work For®, has an opportunity for a Legal Specialist that is a core member of the legal support team responsible for administering benefits matters related to marital litigation and the division of retirement benefits under court orders, such as Qualified Domestic Relations Orders (QDROs), custody orders and subpoenas. This position requires regular verbal and written communication with retirement plan participants and other external parties. This position also provides assistance to the attorneys in the legal department, including research regarding benefit plan requirements and participant records and accounts, as well as general administrative support. The Legal Specialist works under the guidance of the Senior Legal Analyst but must be able to work independently while recognizing when to engage the Senior Legal Analyst and/or attorneys. A successful candidate will have an eye for detail, strong organizational and prioritization skills, and the ability to interact and clearly communicate with a variety of internal and external stakeholders.<br><br>More specifically, as a Legal Specialist, you will have the opportunity to:<br><ul><li> R eview marital litigation and QDRO matters and prepare related correspondence </li><li> P rocess the division of benefits pursuant to QDROs and other court orders, and prepare related documentation </li><li> C ommunicate with participants, alternate payees, attorneys and other external parties </li><li> P rovide financial and benefit plan information to various internal staff and identify and follow up on issues to ensure data accuracy; review/analyze related benefit plan requirements </li><li> A ssist Senior Legal Analyst with workflow, including but not limited to: <br><br></li></ul>oProcess incoming and outgoing mail by updating database and Legal Services indexes<br><br>oReview incoming documents to correctly assign tasks, including coordinating with other functional areas<br><br>oMaintain documentation and other records in department files/indexes and ensure record-keeping is accurate and up-to-date<br><ul><li> Provide general administrative support to professional staff in the Legal Services department, including back-up support to other staff </li><li> W ork on miscellaneous projects as needed <br><br></li></ul><strong> Legal Specialist Benefits: <br></strong><ul><li> Medical, dental, vision and well-being benefits from our HealthFlex Exchange on day one </li><li> 8 % employer contribution to retirement plan with an additional match up to 2% on day one </li><li> 2 2 days of PTO + 12 paid holidays </li><li> H ybrid work environment; able to work effectively whether in the office or in a remote location <br><br></li></ul><strong>Minimum Requirements/Qualifications:<br></strong><ul><li> Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience </li><li> 3-5 years of prior experience working in an office environment in an administrative, support, or customer service role </li><li> Advanced oral and written communications skills </li><li> Advanced knowledge of MS Office applications <br><br></li></ul><strong>Preferred Requirements/Qualifications:<br></strong><ul><li> Related administrative, legal or employee benefits-related experience </li><li> Experience with a benefits administrator or pension record keeper </li><li> Knowledge regarding pension and retirement benefits <br><br></li></ul>Wespath Benefits and Investments is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate in hiring.<br><br>
